title: Venice type
content:
I spent some time in Venice this Summer, and found some interesting type here and there.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ponte_4819.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/memorial_5413.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sun_clock_6646.jpg)

We stayed in the hotel Bologna in Mestre, which had some type dotted about:

the bathroom window (or half of them):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bathroom_4994.jpg)

this was on the corridor wall:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sogni_5930.jpg)
author: mili

comments.content: Love the clock, that's great. Nice pics.

Did you go and see the prints on display in the "Museo Correr"? Beutiful stuff - but they just wouldn't let me take photographs :(  
That was my first real-life encounter with a letterpressed fim-ligature (16th century S. Occhi IIRC, don't have my notes at hand right now).

Unfortunately I didn't go to the Museo Correr, but thanks for the tip, will go next time.

Here are two more clocks:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Clock2_4120.jpg)

and a close-up:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Clock2_closeup_6046.jpg)

This one was in Padua:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Padua_clock_6001.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Padua_closeup_6328.jpg)

i agree- the clock faces are beautiful!  
here are a couple i saw in venice:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/image-2_5748.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102045655im_/http:/typophile.com/files/image_6638.jpg)
